page.title: 04Our village shops-Hordon
page.content: Our Village Shops - Horndon In Horndon we have 3 Shops. One of them is run by Mr. & Mrs. Burdett. It is a sub-post office, general store and bakery. Mr. Burdett is the Baker. He bakes the bread on his premises with the help of his son Paul. We have a butcher's shop which has been run by Reg Bye for about 20 years. The third shop sells newspapers, sweets groceries and has an Off Licence. This shop has just been taken over by Mr. & Mrs. Redhead, who have returned from Australia. Outside Burdett's a man sells green groceries from a stall. He comes on Tuesday, Friday and Saturday mornings. There used to be two more Shops one is now a private house and the other, which was the co-op, is boarded up awaiting development. The Village blacksmith works behind this shop.
